meanings.definition: To equip with or control by computers.
meanings.sent1: The school computerises its classrooms to help students learn better.
meanings.sent2: My dad computerises his workshop to keep track of all his tools.
meanings.sent3: The cat computerises its toy mouse to make it move on its own.
meanings.sent4: The chef computerises the kitchen, turning it into a high-tech cooking space.
meanings.sent5: The scientist computerises the lab, making experiments more efficient.

meanings.definition: To convert data into a digital form that can be processed by a computer.
meanings.sent1: I computerise my notes to keep them organized on my laptop.
meanings.sent2: The company computerises all their files for easy access and storage.
meanings.sent3: The detective computerises the evidence to solve the case faster.
meanings.sent4: The artist computerises their sketches, bringing them to life on screen.
meanings.sent5: The librarian computerises the catalog, making it easier to find books.
